items.preText: 12.59pm All set for the start. Kemar Roach to start off. 12.30pm West Indies have won the toss and will bowl first. West Indies have made one change: Chandrapaul Hemraj is in for Kieran Powell. West Indies: Rovman Powell (capt), Marlon Samuels, Darren Bravo, Devendra Bishoo, Chanderpaul Hemraj, Roston Chase, Shai Hope, Shimron Hetmyer, Kemar Roach, Keemo Paul, Oshane Thomas Bangladesh have retained the XI that played the first ODI. Bangladesh: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Liton Das, 3 Imrul Kayes, 4 Soumya Sarkar, 5 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 6 Shakib Al Hasan, 7 Mahmudullah, 8 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 9 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 10 Mustafizur Rahman, 11 Rubel Hossain 12.08pm Hello and welcome to the second ODI between Bangladesh and West Indies. Another victory for the hosts, and the series will be decided, but before that, today could be a very special day for Bangladesh cricket. Learn all about it as we build up to the toss. As has almost become the norm with Bangladesh, especially in limited overs, and most definitely at home, they have fired in all departments, and are primed to seal the series with a game to spare. West Indies are as susceptible and vulnerable as they have ever been, and it has meant Bangladesh have seamlessly applied the shine over the odd poor performance or two. Read up more on how the two teams stack up in Mohammad Isam's preview. FAHAD: "Surely Bangladesh will try to win this match and secure the series!! Most importantly it will be also a remarkable for them as the best 5 (ponchpandob) are going to make a record with 100 match ODI altogether. "

items.shortText: Thomas to Liton Das, FOUR runs

items.text: full, dipping on leg, clipped into the on side
items.shortText: Thomas to Liton Das, no run

items.text: full, angling into leg, tries to clip it away but the ball dips and hits the back ankle as it rolls away to deep backward square
items.postText: Liton was down in significant pain after that blow. He was attended to by the physio, and is now being stretchered off. Liton retires hurt.
